Title: Senior C# / C++ Quantitative developer
Description:
Quanteam Group is a Consulting firm specialised in the Capital Markets industry, in Paris, London, Brussels, New York and North Africa.

Since 2007, our 450 consultants provide major clients (Corporate & Investment Banks, Asset Managers, Hedge Funds, Brokers and Insurance Companies) with expertise in several projects such as Financial Engineering, Quantitative Research, Regulatory Implementation, IT Transformation & Innovation.

The firm mainly takes part in:

  • Business consulting: Quantitative research, Risk management (e.g. Market risk, credit risk, counterparty risk), Banking regulations (e.g. Basel III, Solvency II, FATCA, EMIR, MiFID), Pricing & Valuation, Organisational Transformation & Process Improvement.
  • IT & Information systems consulting: Business Analysis, Project Management, Change management, Front Office Support (functional and technical), Development (e.g C++, Python, C#, Java, VBA), Financial Softwares (e.g. Sophis, Murex, Summit, Calypso), IT Transformation & Innovation.

As part of Quanteam Group, Quanteam UK (incorporated in 2010) has today more than 60 consultants, working for major Capital Markets players in London.


PROJECTS


Quanteam UK is currently working on various highly skilled projects, with several major Investment Banks in the City.

In particular, we are looking to bring on board experienced Quantitative Developers with the following skills: 

  • Strong C++ and/or C# programming background
  • Investment Banking Front Office / Quantitative Research experience is required
  • A candidate with experience of C++ under Linux environment would be great but not mandatory
  • Microsoft COM (Component Object Model) technology knowledge would be useful but is not a requirement (the client wishes to move from COM to Linux on the long run)
  • Financial products knowledge is a plus, particularly on Fixed Income flow and derivatives products 

This is a long term opportunity (> 1 year minimum).

Title: Senior C# Software Developer - Full Stack Agile Web TDD x 2 CONTRACT
Description:
Senior C# Software Developer (Test Driven Developer C# ASP.NET MVC Full Stack Agile TDD Entity Framework SQL Server Jasmine JavaScript) x2 NEW CONTRACTS

  • Contract 3 months with potential for extension
  • CONTRACT RATES - £400-£600 a Day
  • Immediate Start

Asynchrony Labs UK, a subsidiary of WWT EMEA UK LTD., has opportunities for Senior C# Software Developer /Test Driven Developer encompassing responsibilities along all areas of application development.

JOB ROLE:

  • Senior C# Software Developer will be involved in detailed software design, pair-programming code with unit tests to implement the design, and enterprise architecture integration.
  • Senior C# Software Developer will be responsible for the analysis of business, engineering, and scientific problems, and the documentation and development of well-defined methods, procedures, and programs in the delivery of practical systems solutions.
  • Involved in Full Stack development of projects from beginning to end.
  • Working with peers through the full software development and project life cycle.
  • This role is suitable for a Test Driven Developer, who enjoys working in a Agile environment of testing all development code in C# MVC and automation test tools environment.

ESSENTIAL SKILLS/REQUIREMENTS:

  • Min 5+ years' experience in software development C# and MVC area.
  • Experience in software development methodologies such as Agile in Kanban or SCRUM area.
  • MUST have C# MVC TDD Entity Framework (Code First) SQL Server and Agile
  • Developing Server Side technologies in C#, .NET and web Front End MVC ASP.NET
  • Experience of JavaScript development in JQuery
  • Experience using TFS with Git for version control, CI and build processes.
  • We use Resharper and tests are done in NUnit for C#, Jasmine for JavaScript tests and Selenium with Specflow for Front End testing.
  • Entity Framework - Module First or Code first
  • Experience working with databases and SQL Server
  • Experience in Testing Tools: nUnit, Jasmine testing framework (JavaScript)
  • Must have experience in Entity Framework in Code first
  • Must have experience in Test-Driven Development (TDD) - as we test all our own development code
  • SOLID Principles, Extreme Programming, SCRUM, OOD (Object Orientated Design and Development), BDD
  • Using continuous integration (CI) tools and automated testing
  • Design and architecture of large-scale applications
  • Experience of all elements of a full technology stack
  • Ability to work in a startup environment backed by a large enterprise
  • Design and architecture of large-scale applications
  • Experience of all elements of a full technology stack
  • Excellent inter-personal skills and fluency in English (both verbal and written)
  • This is an office based role here at our Canary Wharf offices in London

DESIRABLE SKILLS:

  • Pair Programming - Must have knowledge in this area as this role requires you to do projects as a pair programmer.
  • Behavior-Driven Development (BDD)

Applicants must be eligible to live and work in the UK. Only successful candidates will be contacted.

KEYWORDS:

Senior Software Developer Test Driven Developer C# .NET ASP.NET MVC MVC.NET Frontend Web Developer Mobile Developer Full Stack Android iOS Agile Pair Programming TDD Kanban Enterprise Web Applications Lead Mobile Developer iOS and Android C# Software Developer C# Developer .NET Software Developer C# Developer .NET Analyst Programmer .NET Application Developer C# Software Engineer C# Analyst Programmer .NET Senior Developer .NET Senior Software Engineer C# Senior Web Application Developer .NET Senior Web Application Developer, iOS, Windows Phone, Android, React-Native, SCRUM, Extreme Programming, Android and iOS Developer, Backend Development, XP C C++ Senior Web Developer

Company:

The world is changing - fast. To keep pace, companies need to find new ways to get to market faster, disrupt the status quo, optimize operational models, and create experiences their employees and consumers desire. Companies know they must embrace digital, but too often they start the process at the end - with prescriptive technology. We start with the customer.

Asynchrony Labs identifies business needs - then designs, develops, and integrates custom software solutions for clients across the Department of Defense, Health Care, Financial Services, Retail and every industry in-between. Our flexible methodologies and multi-disciplined delivery teams promote intuitive experiences, unparalleled quality, regular analysis of metrics, and iterative product testing.

Backed by World Wide Technology (WWT) - a $9B global technology integrator with expertise across supply chain, networking, collaboration, and security - we form a unique nucleus of end-to-end creative and technology capabilities needed to help transform our clients' businesses at scale. Our teams are deeply connected and bring their shared insights across industries, disciplines, and markets to every engagement.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES

World Wide Technology is committed to equal opportunities and actively seeks applications from all sectors of the community irrespective of sex, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, having responsibility for dependents, age, religion/beliefs, or any other reason which cannot be shown to be justified.

STRICTLY NO AGENCIES - ONLY DIRECT APPLICATIONS

Title: .Net Senior Developer-Contract
Description:
Senior .Net Developer - ASP.Net Core MVC, C#, Docker, AWS, Team City, Git, TDD

Full Stack .Net Engineer needed to join our Tribe and work with one of our scrum teams to help us keep our customers happy, solve the challenges of continuous delivery in a rapidly growing platform whilst in an evolving marketplace. For us, teamwork is everything. We listen to each other, we adapt and we value honest feedback to help us keep on improving. We are making significant investment in DevOps at scale and we will invest in you.

Our Tech Stack/Tools

  • C#, .Net Core MVC, CSS/jQuery, react, SQL Server
  • TDD, Agile, pair programming
  • GitHub, Team City, Octopus CI/CD deploy pipeline
  • AWS, Terraform, Docker Containers, ECS
  • Kibana, Grafana Dashboard and Exceptionless

A typical week as a developer might involve:

  • Start your day with a stand up, then spin up your vm and bham, you're ready to go
  • Pair with your team mates, write some tests and implement your app
  • Realise a team member has left their laptop unlocked and turn their screen upside down (unwritten rule - don't do this to your pairing partner)
  • Review a pull request and deploy to production through your CI pipeline - pat yourself on the back
  • Coffee and Table Tennis break in the morning, then pop to Borough Market for lunch or go to a “lunch & learn”
  • Come across a show stopper, figure out as a team what to do, run some whiteboard design sessions (realising you've used a permanent marker, you quickly leave the room)
  • Design and experiment in your team retro on the roof terrace
  • Mingle with peeps from other tribes at Innovation day demos with beers and snacks

What we’d like from you:

  • Bring your whole self to work
  • Ability and/or experience to mentor, guide and lead by example
  • Super interested in all things technical
  • Willing to participate in and often lead technical discussion(s)
  • Commitment to high quality, maintainable code
  • Happy to collaborate with a wide group of stakeholders

Cool stuff you’ll like:

  • Weekly exercise club
  • 10th floor roof terrace with bar (yoga on a Monday, drinks on Thursday/Friday)
  • Scrum team social budget for lunch and events
  • Tribe events and socials
  • Monthly innovation day (work on whatever you like)
  • Hackathons
  • Free nerf guns and ammo
  • Amazing location – Tate Modern, The Globe, Borough Market
  • Subsidised canteen with a view

So, why us?

We have a simple purpose – to enable job seekers and organisations to achieve greater success. Our people are helping 9 million job seekers to find their dream job every month. Our websites are visited nearly 18 million times per month with over 80 million page impressions. Our expert matching technology, and best in class UX drives over 5.2 million applications every month.

Since becoming part of the StepStone family, we’ve focussed on creating a unique and collaborative culture where we all share the same values and beliefs that makes Totaljobs Group an even better place to build your career. Our people are the key to our success and they have voted us to be a Great Place to Work for the past 10 years!

This is your chance to join us and make a huge impact as we continue the journey to become smarter and more efficient than ever before. Apply now! You know you want to…

  • Reference: CWJobs/1359
  • Job ID: 79949957

Title: SQL Developer - 15 days
Description:
We have an urgent requirement for a SQL Developer with experience of NHS Data sets and EPR systems - preferably Systmone - to develop procedures to create viable data sets from Systmone Community Health data. You will be required to engage with services to pursue completion of mandatory and desirable data fields to utilise from 01 April. you will also be required to provide clear documentation about what has been developed, where it is stored and how to run procedures.

Responsibilities include:
* Extract raw data from SystmOne SR tables.
* Transfer into correct formats and ensure correctly mapped fields by NHSI CSDS guidance.
* Map the national codes currently from the SR tables, spot any gaps and record clear, detailed recommendations where CNWL CH services and/or Systems configuration is needed to fix it.
* Set up ETL procedures, Alpha test the outputs and cross check for completeness and accuracy from other sources and from knowledge and experience of CNWL colleagues.

Essential Experience includes:
* Excellent documentation skills,
* Advanced SQL.
* Advanced knowledge and use of SystmOne
* Working knowledge of NHS Community services OR close proximity working to an analyst who can give rapid insight and support when needed.
* Excellent communication skills / quick learner of new technical information.


LA International Computer Consultants Ltd is an HMG Approved Consultancy and operates as an IT & Engineering Consultancy or as an Employment Business & Agency, depending upon the precise nature of the work, for security cleared jobs or non-clearance vacancies, we welcome applications from all sections of the community and from people with diverse experience and backgrounds. Award Winning LA International Computer Consultants Ltd (Recruiter Awards for Excellence - Best IT, Best Public Sector & Gold Awards) and the most prestigious award that any business can receive The Queens Award for Enterprise: International Trade 2015.

Title: Senior Data Warehouse Tester
Description:
Senior Data Warehouse Tester
Watford
9 months
£350 - £450 per day depending on experience

A Senior Data Warehouse Tester is required to join one of my prestigious clients based near Watford on an initial 9 months contract paying between £350 - £450 per day depending on experience.

As the Senior Data Warehouse Tester, you will work closely with the Test Manager and carry out all testing for a Dimensional Data Warehouse, Reports and Cubes built on SQL Server 2016/2017.

Key responsibilities for the Senior Data Warehouse Tester include:

* Work with the Test Manager and the DWH Project Manager to create the Test Strategy/ Test Approach document
* Create high-level Test Scenarios and Detailed Test Cases covering all aspects for the Data Warehouse Development
* Work with the DWH Development DBA/ Lead BI Developer to create an approach to testing all the Database Objects (using a test lead development approach)
* Work with the DWH Business Analyst to determine the Test Data which will be used;
* Manage End Users through the User Acceptance Testing
* Carry out Performance Testing of the DWH solution as and when required
* Work with the IT Support Team to carry out any Operational Acceptance Testing required
* Work with the DWH Development DBA/ Lead BI Developer to set-up and refresh all the Development and Test environments

Essential skills required for the Senior Data Warehouse Tester include:

* Proven experience in Data Warehouse Testing
* Strong hands-on manual & Automation testing experience
* Good understanding of Dimensional Data Warehousing using MS SQL Server 2016/2017
* Strong experience in writing complex SQL/TSQL queries to test databases and Data Warehouses, perform data manipulation and verification and set up test data.
* Proven adaptive test strategies gained from test experience across Agile, Waterfall, Kanban SDLC processes.
* Strong experience of planning test scenarios, writing and executing test plans and test cases, and creating required test data.
* Strong problem-solving skills, ability to think ahead, with good eye for detail and routing out / searching those dark corners.
* Genuine interest in the power of data/technology and a curious mind.
* Performance Testing of MS SSRS Reports & Dashboards and MS SSAS Cubes

The culture is one that promotes creativity and the ability to think outside of the box. To apply for this role please urgently click apply.

Venturi is a staffing business dedicated to you, differentiating ourselves in the marketplace by quality of service and candidate delivery. Our highly skilled and experienced staff operate within dedicated markets to give you the best service possible. Venturi markets include Business Intelligence, Development IT & Legal IT. Venturi operates as an employment agency and employment business. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age for this role.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The role of Data Scientist will be a key position within the Big Data analytics team.

We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to work closely with the Lead Data Scientist to explore local countries Big Data Analytics opportunities as well as supporting and capitalising on Central Functional Team innovation initiatives. You will be working with key stakeholders within the local country to generate hypotheses and supports the analytics modelling managers to create models that answer impactful business questions.



As Data Scientist your main responsibilities will involve:



  • Translating complex datasets into key strategic insight and powerful capabilities, to the business:


  • Participating in cutting-edge research projects in collaboration with Universities e.g. Deep Learning, Social Network Analysis


  • Support a global community of data scientists across countries and business streams


  • Identify new analytics trends and opportunities to drive the innovation agenda across countries


  • Identify new data sources and evaluate emerging technologies for data discovery usage


  • Be recognised as an expert in Big Data Analytics, advising on the suitability of Big Data products and solutions


  • Advise the analytics modelling managers on best practice methodology for Big Data Analytics


  • Delve into data from different systems, at different timescales, and in complex formats to discover hidden relationships and useful information


  • Advise on best practice Big Data Analytics methodology and processes for analytics insight generation, technology and data

    As Data Scientist your skills and qualifications will ideally include:
    • Machine learning Libraries - Spark ML, scikit-learn, xgboost, Tensorflow + Keras, GraphFrames


  • Working knowledge of Big Data statistical analytics tools (e.g. Python, R, Scala)


  • Experience in Big Data Analytics landscape and technology trends (e.g. Spark, Hadoop, NoSQL, SQL)


  • Familiar with leading visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau, Qlikview, Spotfire, D3.js)


  • Significant experience in Big Data analytics & deployment of models and algorithms into a commercial/consumer environment in order to analyse extremely large volumes of structured data


  • Ability to test hypotheses from raw data sets and draw meaningful conclusions


  • Deep and broad statistical modelling expertise in various domains


  • Good communication skills, with proven ability to work cross-functional teams to translate business issues into potential analytics solutions


  • Master's or Bachelor's Degree in quantitative fields like Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computing and Engineering




Please email your CV to be considered for the position.

  • Contact: Harry Back
  • Reference: CWJobs/Data Scientist-V
  • Job ID: 80229800

Title: Elite 3 Lead Developer
Description:
Lead Elite 3E Developer

Central London

6-12 Months

up to £750 per day D.O.E

A large consultancy I am working with have asked me to source a lead Elite 3E Developer for an immediate start in their central London office. This is an exciting opportunity to work for a leading law firm who are part of the UK "magic circle".

As the lead Elite 3E Developer you will have the following key responsibilities and deliverables:

  • Lead software development work-streams providing end to end ownership including; specification and design, estimation and planning, build, release and support
  • Developing new software applications / modules / customisations in partnership with other members of the development team, business analysts and technical architects.
  • Liaise with business users as required within the role, maintaining a high level of service within all aspects of the individual's work
  • Work collaboratively as part of a team or individually to achieve business outcomes, maintaining constructive working relationships with IT peers
  • Unit testing software to ensure the code is correct, fixing errors where they occur, and rerunning and rechecking the programme until it produces the correct results
  • Provide 3rd level support to in-house developed applications, integrations and the Elite 3e product

Title: Capacity Manager (SC Clearance)
Description:
Capacity Manager (SC Clearance)

Capacity Manager (SC Cleared)

3 Month + (view to extend)

A new and fantastic opportunity has arisen for an SC Cleared Capacity Manager to join the Capacity Management Team in Hatfield. The successful candidate will ensure that all current and future capacity and performance aspects of the IT infrastructure are provided to meet business requirements at acceptable cost. Come and join our client's fantastic Capacity Management team in Hatfield and be part of what really makes them great.

Main Responsibilities:
Within their Capacity Management team in Hatfield, you will be establishing Capacity base lines for each customer contract, ensuring that there is adequate IT capacity to meet required levels of service, and that senior IT management is correctly advised on how to match capacity and demand and to ensure that use of existing capacity is optimised are key elements of this varied role. Reporting and presenting on discoveries that could impact components of the infrastructure to stakeholders at all levels.

  • Understanding the current usage of the infrastructure and IT services, and the maximum capacity of each component
  • Liaise with Incident and Problem management to assess impact of Capacity related threshold breaches
  • Accumulate information for all new or changed infrastructures and define expansion requirements
  • Perform trend analysis, estimate overall growth (decrease) of user demand
  • Forecasting future capacity requirements based on business plans, usage trends, sizing of new services, etc.
  • Production, regular review and revision of the Capacity Plan, in line with the organization's business planning cycle, identifying current usage and forecast requirements during the period covered by the plan
  • Analysis of usage and performance data, and reporting on Service and Component performance against targets contained in SLAs
  • Ensuring that all changes are assessed for their impact on capacity and performance and attending CAB meetings when appropriate
  • Producing regular management reports that include current usage of resources, trends and forecasts


The Ideal Candidate:
As an experienced Capacity Manager you will already have an understanding and experience in a capacity management background covering cloud, server, storage, networks, virtualised environments, applications and databases. Holding a deep knowledge of Capacity Management toolsets. BMC; VROps; SCOM; Power BI; Squared Up; SQL, these toolsets in particular would be an ideal with BMC TSCO, CLM being a stand out advantage. Bringing a sound understanding of ITIL methodology and service management best practices are a must to be a success in this role.

Please note that due to the urgency of this role, preference will be given to candidates that are currently SC cleared, candidates that are willing to undergo the security clearance process will be considered however SC clearance is an essential requirement for this role

For us, teamwork is everything. We listen to each other, we adapt and we value honest feedback to help us keep on improving. We are making significant investment in DevOps at scale and we will invest in you.

Our Tech Stack/Tools

  • C#, .Net Core MVC, CSS/jQuery, react, SQL Server
  • TDD, Agile, pair programming
  • GitHub, Team City, Octopus CI/CD deploy pipeline
  • AWS, Terraform, Docker Containers, ECS
  • Kibana, Grafana Dashboard and Exceptionless

A typical week as a developer might involve:

  • Start your day with a stand up, then spin up your vm and bham, you're ready to go
  • Pair with your team mates, write some tests and implement your app
  • Realise a team member has left their laptop unlocked and turn their screen upside down (unwritten rule - don't do this to your pairing partner)
  • Review a pull request and deploy to production through your CI pipeline - pat yourself on the back
  • Coffee and Table Tennis break in the morning, then pop to Borough Market for lunch or go to a “lunch & learn”
  • Come across a show stopper, figure out as a team what to do, run some whiteboard design sessions (realising you've used a permanent marker, you quickly leave the room)
  • Design and experiment in your team retro on the roof terrace
  • Mingle with peeps from other tribes at Innovation day demos with beers and snacks

What we’d like from you:

  • Bring your whole self to work
  • Ability and/or experience to mentor, guide and lead by example
  • Super interested in all things technical
  • Willing to participate in and often lead technical discussion(s)
  • Commitment to high quality, maintainable code
  • Happy to collaborate with a wide group of stakeholders

Cool stuff you’ll like:

  • Weekly exercise club
  • 10th floor roof terrace with bar (yoga on a Monday, drinks on Thursday/Friday)
  • Scrum team social budget for lunch and events
  • Tribe events and socials
  • Monthly innovation day (work on whatever you like)
  • Hackathons
  • Free nerf guns and ammo
  • Amazing location – Tate Modern, The Globe, Borough Market
  • Subsidised canteen with a view

So, why us?

We have a simple purpose – to enable job seekers and organisations to achieve greater success. Our people are helping 9 million job seekers to find their dream job every month. Our websites are visited nearly 18 million times per month with over 80 million page impressions. Our expert matching technology, and best in class UX drives over 5.2 million applications every month.

Since becoming part of the StepStone family, we’ve focussed on creating a unique and collaborative culture where we all share the same values and beliefs that makes Totaljobs Group an even better place to build your career. Our people are the key to our success and they have voted us to be a Great Place to Work for the past 10 years!

This is your chance to join us and make a huge impact as we continue the journey to become smarter and more efficient than ever before. Apply now! You know you want to…

Title: Cloud Architect
Description:
Cloud Architect

  • Germany or UK based with frequent travel to Germany
  • Rate 650 to 750 gbp per day
  • Start March 2018
  • 6 month contract full time

Our global valued Telco client needs a Cloud Architect to design their Cloud environments with a focus on Azure and AWS. 

You will demonstrate technical cloud Architecture knowledge playing a vital role in the design of production, staging, QA and development of Cloud Infrastructures running in 24x7 environments. The role will focus on delivery of our customers cloud strategies with a focus on Cloud Migrations.

You will provide leadership in infrastructure migration methodologies and techniques including mass application movements into the cloud including implementation of Azure or AWS within large regulated enterprise environments. You will nurture Cloud computing expertise internally and externally to drive Cloud Adoption.

To succeed

  • Azure or AWS based Cloud Architecture and migration skills and experience.
  • Strong understanding across Cloud and infrastructure components (server, storage, network, data, and applications) to deliver end to end Cloud Infrastructure architectures and designs.
  • Knowledge of further Cloud technologies (Azure, S3, VMware)
  • 4+ years' experience as an IT Infrastructure Architect, with focus on Azure, cloud, server, storage and networking.
  • 10+ years' experience with MS Server Operating Systems
  • 4+ years' experience with MS SQL, Sharepoint and .NET
  • Experience in leading a team applying all elements of Technical Consulting
  • Excellent communication & interpersonal skills
  • Understands and can articulate the technical merits and value of Cloud computing
  • Experience with “on-premise to cloud” migrations or IT transformations
  • Experience architecting/operating solutions build on AWS
  • Excellent communication skills with an ability to right level conversations
  • Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers
  • Passionate, persuasive, articulate Cloud professional capable of quickly establishing interest and credibility in how to design, deploy and operate cloud based Architectures. Strong written, verbal and chalk board skills
  • Experience in working in Prince2 or PMI, Agile methodology managed projects is valued.
  • Experience in enterprise applications, solutions and data center infrastructures
Great opportunity! Please APPLY NOW or connect with our Talent Acquisition Manager Bri Bell for more information.

Title: Java Developer - ( eTrading / Ivestment Bank )
Description:
Java Developer - ( eTrading / Ivestment Bank )

My client a world renown investment bank with a presence in over 70+ countries is seeking a Java Developer with experience in eTrading for a long term contract in London.

Department overview

The Credit IT division is responsible for the technology used by all areas of the global Credit business. Within Credit IT, the Credit ETS team is responsible for the design, development & maintenance of internal price distribution, aggregation and contribution of prices and orders to the markets. The asset classes covered on the eTrading platform are credit Bonds, FRNs, single-name CDS and index CDS.



The Credit ETS development team is based in London and New York. The platform is deployed globally in Europe, Americas and Asia; the London development team liaises with global support teams to ensure the stability and uptime of the platform.



The Credit business has identified eTrading as a key area in which they would like to develop in terms of reliability and functionality hence success in this area is regarded as essential to help the business succeed.



Job Description



Mty client is seeking an experienced developer whose expertise is in Java primarily working on server side components. They will work on design and implementing features for Credit eTrading order management and market connectivity layers. This will include build out of bond quoting from an Algo Engine, enhancements to Bonds Auto Negotiation engine and the build out of an internal RFQ workflow between sales and trading.



The qualified applicant should possess experience with producing clean, high performance, scalable and testable applications, while demonstrating a great sense of design and attention to detail.



Candidates must have front-office team experience and any knowledge of eTrading systems, ideally within Credit.



Required Skills and Qualifications



Experience with Java 7.0+

Must have experience with multi-threading programming

Experience with asynchronous and event driven programming

Experience developing real-time applications

Familiar with building distributed systems

Knowledge of networks and topologies

Firm grounding of common algorithms

Familiar working with LINUX environments

Familiar with Oracle / SQL Server



Excellent oral and written communication skills

Proactive team player with a "can-do" attitude

Excellent analytical problem solver

Attention to detail and thoroughness a must

Ability to design and implement unit tests (with JUnit) and integrate into automated build process

End-to-end ownership - ensure the code that you write is carried through to production



Desired Skills/Experience

A working knowledge of Fixed Income instruments including Credit Default Swaps

Knowledge of [ION] third party market data connectivity API

Experience working in a Front office team

Title: Senior C# / C++ Quantitative developer
Description:
Senior C# / C++ Quantitative developer

Quanteam Group is a Consulting firm specialised in the Capital Markets industry, in Paris, London, Brussels, New York and North Africa.

Since 2007, our 450 consultants provide major clients (Corporate & Investment Banks, Asset Managers, Hedge Funds, Brokers and Insurance Companies) with expertise in several projects such as Financial Engineering, Quantitative Research, Regulatory Implementation, IT Transformation & Innovation.

The firm mainly takes part in:

  • Business consulting: Quantitative research, Risk management (e.g. Market risk, credit risk, counterparty risk), Banking regulations (e.g. Basel III, Solvency II, FATCA, EMIR, MiFID), Pricing & Valuation, Organisational Transformation & Process Improvement.
  • IT & Information systems consulting: Business Analysis, Project Management, Change management, Front Office Support (functional and technical), Development (e.g C++, Python, C#, Java, VBA), Financial Softwares (e.g. Sophis, Murex, Summit, Calypso), IT Transformation & Innovation.

As part of Quanteam Group, Quanteam UK (incorporated in 2010) has today more than 60 consultants, working for major Capital Markets players in London.


PROJECTS


Quanteam UK is currently working on various highly skilled projects, with several major Investment Banks in the City.

In particular, we are looking to bring on board experienced Quantitative Developers with the following skills: 

  • Strong C++ and/or C# programming background
  • Investment Banking Front Office / Quantitative Research experience is required
  • A candidate with experience of C++ under Linux environment would be great but not mandatory
  • Microsoft COM (Component Object Model) technology knowledge would be useful but is not a requirement (the client wishes to move from COM to Linux on the long run)
  • Financial products knowledge is a plus, particularly on Fixed Income flow and derivatives products 

This is a long term opportunity (> 1 year minimum).
